title: windows-event-log
description:
The Windows_Event_Log object is intended to characterize entries in the Windows event log. Microsoft's Event schema is described at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa385201 and the .NET API is described at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/y80k1300.aspx. Based on http://uk.sans.org/reading-room/whitepapers/logging/evtx-windows-event-logging-32949. The following table is a list which Microsoft (Event Properties, 2008) has defined as the
most common event properties.

type.description: The value of this property MUST be `windows-event-log`.

source.description: Specifies The software that logged the event.

event_id.description:
A number identifying the particular event type. The first line of the
description usually contains the name of the event type.

level.description: A classification of the event severity.

user.description:
The name of the user on whose behalf the event occurred. This name is
the client ID if the event was actually caused by a server process or the
primary ID if impersonation is not taking place.

operational_code.description:
Contains a numeric value that identifies the activity or a point within an
activity that the application was performing when it raised the event.

log.description: The name of the log where the event was recorded.

task_category.description: Used to represent a subcomponent or activity of the event publisher.

keywords.description: A set of categories or tags that can be used to filter or search for events.

computer.description: The name of the computer on which the event occurred.

date_time.description: The date and time that the event was logged.

process_id.description: The identification number for the process that generated the event.

thread_id.description: The identification number for the thread that generated the event.

processor_id.description: The identification number for the processor that processed the event.

session_id.description: The identification number of the terminal server session in whcih the event occured.

kernal_time.description:
The elapsed execution time for kernal-mode instructions, in CPU time
units.

user_time.description: The elapsed execution time for user-mode instructions, in CPU time units.

processor_time.description: The elapsed execution time for user-mode instructions, in CPU ticks.

correlation_id.description:
Identifies the activity in the process for which the event is involved. This
identifier is used to specify simple relationships between events.

relative_correlation_id.description: Identifies a related activity in a process for which the event is involved.
